00073 #ifndef SO_REUSEPORT
00074 #define SO_REUSEPORT 15

00077 
00078 // When defined, the original semaphores are used, instead of the pthread
00079 // mutexes. This causes a race condition to blocked_sem on SMP. (Bram)
00080 #undef USE_SEMA
00081 
00082 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00083 sem_t log_sem;
00084 #define GETLOG \
00085 if (sem_wait(&log_sem)) perror("sem_wait");
00086 #define YIELDLOG \
00087 if (sem_post(&log_sem)) perror("sem_post");
00088 #else
00089 pthread_mutex_t log_mutex;
00090 #define GETLOG \
00091 if (pthread_mutex_lock(&log_mutex)) perror("pthread_mutex_lock");
00092 #define YIELDLOG \
00093 if (pthread_mutex_unlock(&log_mutex)) perror("pthread_mutex_unlock");
00094 #endif
00095 
00096 #define LOGPRINTF(fmt,a...)   \
00097    if (logptr<sizeof(logbuf)-80) { logptr += sprintf(logbuf+logptr, fmt, ##a); }
00098 #define LOGTUPLE(s)    print_tuple(s);
00099 
00104 struct ttuple
00105 {
00106         struct tuple *tuple;
00107         struct ttuple *next;
00108         struct ttuple *previous;
00109 };
00110 
00115 static struct ttuple *first_message = NULL;
00116 
00121 static struct ttuple *last_message = NULL;
00122 
00123 
00124 
00125 #define MAXNUMTHREADS 64
00126 
00131 static struct context client_list[MAXNUMTHREADS];
00132 static char status_list[MAXNUMTHREADS+1];
00133 
00134 
00140 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00141 static sem_t tuple_space_access;
00142 #define GETACCESS \
00143 if (sem_wait(&tuple_space_access)) perror("sem_wait");
00144 #define YIELDACCESS \
00145 if (sem_post(&tuple_space_access)) perror("sem_wait");
00146 #else
00147 static pthread_mutex_t access_mutex;
00148 #define GETACCESS \
00149 if (pthread_mutex_lock(&access_mutex)) perror("mutex_lock");
00150 #define YIELDACCESS \
00151 if (pthread_mutex_unlock(&access_mutex)) perror("mutex_unlock");
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 
00155 
00159 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00160 static int num_blocked=0;
00161 static sem_t blocked_sem;
00162 #else
00163 static pthread_mutex_t blocked_mutex;
00164 static pthread_cond_t  blocked_cond;
00165 #endif
00166 
00167 
00168 static void print_status(void)
00169 {
00170   int i;
00171   static char lastprint[MAXNUMTHREADS+1];
00172 
00173   if (!strcmp(lastprint, status_list)) return;
00174   strcpy(lastprint, status_list);
00175   fprintf(stderr,status_list);
00176   for (i=0; i<MAXNUMTHREADS; i++)
00177     fputc(8,stderr);
00178   fflush(stderr);
00179 }
00180 
00181 
00182 static void print_thread_func(void *varg)
00183 {
00184   while (1)
00185   {
00186     print_status();
00187     usleep(1000);
00188   }
00189 }

00191 
00197 static void
00198 add_tuple_to_space(struct tuple *t)
00199 {
00200         struct ttuple *s;
00201         s = (struct ttuple *)malloc(sizeof(struct ttuple));
00202         if (s == NULL) {
00203                 perror("malloc failed");
00204                 exit(1);
00205         }
00206         s->tuple = t;
00207         s->next = NULL;
00208 
00209         GETACCESS;
00210         if (last_message == NULL)
00211                 first_message = s;
00212         else
00213                 last_message->next = s;
00214         s->previous = last_message;
00215         last_message = s;
00216         YIELDACCESS;
00217 
00218         // wake up all blocked threads
00219 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00220         while (num_blocked)
00221         {
00222                 if (sem_post(&blocked_sem)) perror("sem_post");
00223                 num_blocked--;
00224         }
00225 #else
00226         if (pthread_mutex_lock(&blocked_mutex)) perror("mutex_lock");
00227         if (pthread_cond_broadcast(&blocked_cond)) perror("cond_broadcast");
00228         if (pthread_mutex_unlock(&blocked_mutex)) perror("mutex_unlock");
00229 #endif
00230 }
00231 
00232 
00233 
00238 static void
00239 remove_message_from_space(struct ttuple *s)
00240 {
00241         if (s->previous == NULL && s->next == NULL) {
00242                 /* I am the only message */
00243                 first_message = last_message = NULL;
00244         }
00245         else if (s->next == NULL) {
00246                 /* I am the last message */
00247                 last_message = s->previous;
00248                 last_message->next = NULL;
00249         }
00250         else if (s->previous == NULL) {
00251                 /* I am the first message */
00252                 first_message = s->next;
00253                 first_message->previous = NULL;
00254         }
00255         else {
00256                 /* I have both a previous and a next */
00257                 s->previous->next = s->next;
00258                 s->next->previous = s->previous;
00259         }
00260 }

00263 
00267 static void
00268 kill_this_thread(struct context *arg)
00269 {
00270 #if 0
00271         GETLOG;
00272         LOGPRINTF("closing ctx %d to %s\n", arg->id, arg->peername);
00273         YIELDLOG;
00274 #endif
00275 
00276         if (close(arg->sock))
00277                 perror("close");
00278         // If the thr field is -1, we signal that it is ready for re-use.
00279         assert(arg->thr != -1);
00280         arg->thr = -1;
00281 
00282         int clientnr = arg - client_list;
00283         status_list[clientnr]='-';
00284 
00285         pthread_exit(NULL);
00286 }
00287

00289 
00293 static void
00294 handle_get_read(struct context *ctx,
00295                 struct tuple *s, int remove, int blocking)
00296 {
00297         struct ttuple *p;
00298         int clientnr = ctx - client_list;
00299 
00300 #if 0
00301         GETLOG;
00302         LOGPRINTF("%s(%d) wants a tuple:", ctx->peername, ctx->id);
00303         LOGTUPLE(s);
00304         YIELDLOG;
00305 #endif
00306         while (1) {
00307                 status_list[clientnr]='a';
00308                 GETACCESS;
00309                 for (p = first_message; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00310                         if (tuples_match(p->tuple, s)) {
00311                                 if (remove) {
00312                                         remove_message_from_space(p);
00313                                 }
00314                                 YIELDACCESS;
00315                                 GETLOG;
00316                                 LOGPRINTF("%s(%d) %s a tuple:", ctx->peername, ctx->id, (remove)?"gets":"reads");
00317                                 LOGTUPLE(p->tuple);
00318                                 YIELDLOG;
00319                                 if (send_tuple(ctx, p->tuple)) {
00320                                         PRINTF("send_tuple failed\n");
00321                                         /* Assume the client died while blocked.
00322                                          * If the tuple was removed, put it back.
00323                                          * Otherwise just kill this thread.
00324                                          */
00325                                         LOGPRINTF("send_tuple failed\n");
00326                                         LOGTUPLE(s);
00327                                         DBGPRINTF("remove=%d\n", remove);
00328                                         if (remove) {
00329                                                 add_tuple_to_space(p->tuple);
00330                                                 destroy_tuple(s);
00331                                                 return;
00332                                         }
00333                                 }
00334                                 if (remove) {
00335                                         destroy_tuple(p->tuple);
00336                                 }
00337                                 destroy_tuple(s);
00338                                 return;
00339                         }
00340                 }
00341 
00342 #if 0
00343                 GETLOG;
00344                 LOGPRINTF("Socket %d couldn't find a match for ", ctx->sock);
00345                 LOGTUPLE(s);
00346                 YIELDLOG;
00347 #endif
00348 
00349                 YIELDACCESS;
00350                 if (blocking) {
00351                         /* wait for a tuple that might match */
00352 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00353                         num_blocked++;
00354                         if (sem_wait(&blocked_sem))
00355                           perror("sem_wait");
00356 #else
00357                         status_list[clientnr]='m';
00358                         if (pthread_mutex_lock(&blocked_mutex)) 
00359                                 perror("mutex_lock");
00360                         status_list[clientnr]='b';
00361                         if (pthread_cond_wait(&blocked_cond, &blocked_mutex)) 
00362                                 perror("cond_wait");
00363                         status_list[clientnr]='u';
00364                         if (pthread_mutex_unlock(&blocked_mutex)) 
00365                                 perror("mutex_unlock");
00366 #endif
00367                 }
00368                 else {
00369                         /* don't wait, return a failure code */
00370                         int ack = -1;
00371                         if (send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &ack, sizeof(int)))
00372                         {
00373                                 perror("Cannot send -1 return code");
00374                         }
00375                         return;
00376                 }
00377         }
00378 }
00379 
00380 
00384 static void
00385 handle_replace(struct context *ctx, struct tuple *template, struct tuple *replacement)
00386 {
00387         int is_deleting=1, del_count=0;
00388         struct ttuple *p;
00389         int clientnr = ctx - client_list;
00390         int operation = REPLACE;
00391 
00392         status_list[clientnr]='a';
00393         GETACCESS;
00394         while (is_deleting) {
00395                 for (p = first_message; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00396                         if (tuples_match(p->tuple, template)) {
00397                                 remove_message_from_space(p);
00398                                 del_count++;
00399                                 break;
00400                         }
00401                 }
00402                 if (p == NULL)
00403                         is_deleting = 0;
00404         }
00405 
00406         YIELDACCESS;
00407 
00408         GETLOG;
00409         LOGPRINTF("%s(%d) replaced %d tuples with:", ctx->peername, ctx->id, del_count);
00410         LOGTUPLE(replacement);
00411         YIELDLOG;
00412 
00413         status_list[clientnr]='p';
00414         add_tuple_to_space(replacement);
00415 
00416         /* send an ack, not sure if this is really req'd? */
00417         send(ctx->sock, &operation, sizeof(int), MSG_NOSIGNAL);
00418         // advise peer that we stop sending
00419         SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00420 
00421         destroy_tuple(template);
00422 }
00423 
00424 
00429 static void
00430 handle_dump_count_space(struct context *ctx, int dump)
00431 {
00432         struct ttuple *p;
00433         int num_templates;
00434         struct tuple **templates = NULL;
00435         int i, ok, count;
00436         struct tuple_list *x, *tlist = NULL;
00437 
00438         recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &num_templates, sizeof(int));
00439 
00440         if (num_templates) {
00441                 templates =
00442                         (struct tuple **) malloc(num_templates *
00443                                                  sizeof(struct tuple *));
00444                 if (templates == NULL) {
00445                         /* ? ? ? ? ? ? */
00446                         return;
00447                 }
00448                 for (i = 0; i < num_templates; i++) {
00449                         templates[i] = recv_tuple(ctx);
00450                         if (templates[i] == NULL) {
00451                                 /* ? ? ? ? ? ? */
00452                                 return;
00453                         }
00454                 }
00455         }
00456 
00457         count = 0;
00458         GETACCESS;
00459         for (p = first_message; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00460                 ok = 0;
00461                 for (i = 0; i < num_templates; i++) {
00462                         if (tuples_match(p->tuple, templates[i])) {
00463                                 ok = 1;
00464                                 break;
00465                         }
00466                 }
00467                 if (ok || num_templates == 0) {
00468                         if (dump) {
00469                                 x = malloc(sizeof(struct tuple_list));
00470                                 if (x == NULL) {
00471                                         /* ? ? ? ? */
00472                                         return;
00473                                 }
00474                                 x->tup = p->tuple;
00475                                 x->next = tlist;
00476                                 tlist = x;
00477                         }
00478                         count++;
00479                 }
00480         }
00481 
00482         send_chunk(ctx, (char *) &count, sizeof(int));
00483 
00484         for (x = tlist; x != NULL; x = x->next) {
00485                 if (send_tuple(ctx, x->tup)) {
00486                         /* Assume the client died.
00487                          */
00488                         perror("send_tuple failed for dump operation");
00489                         YIELDACCESS;
00490                         return;
00491                 }
00492         }
00493         YIELDACCESS;
00494 
00495         while (tlist) {
00496                 x = tlist;
00497                 tlist = tlist->next;
00498                 free(x);
00499         }
00500         if (templates)
00501                 free(templates);
00502 }
00503 
00504 
00509 static void *
00510 client_thread_func(void *varg)
00511 {
00512         struct context *ctx = (struct context *) varg;
00513         int clientnr = ctx - client_list;
00514         status_list[clientnr]='r';
00515         struct tuple *s, *t;
00516         unsigned int operation;
00517 #if 0
00518         int optval=1;
00519         /*
00520          * Set some socket options, so that we have fast response
00521          */
00522         if (setsockopt (ctx->sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, &optval, sizeof (optval)))
00523                 perror("setsockopt failed on TCP_NODELAY");
00524 #endif
00525 
00526 #if 0
00527         int reuseport=1;
00528         if (setsockopt(ctx->sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT, &reuseport, sizeof(int)))
00529                 perror("setsockopt REUSEPORT");
00530 #endif
00531 
00532         if (recv_chunk(ctx, (char *) &operation, sizeof(int))) {
00533                 fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive an operation identifier from client\n");
00534                 kill_this_thread(ctx);
00535         }
00536         if (operation == PUT) {
00537                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00538                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00539                 if (s == NULL) {
00540                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a template from client\n");
00541                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00542                 }
00543                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00544                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00545 //              GETLOG;
00546 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00547 //              LOGPRINTF("PUT socket=%d  ", ctx->sock);
00548 //              LOGTUPLE(s);
00549 //              YIELDLOG;
00550                 status_list[clientnr]='p';
00551 #if 1
00552                 GETLOG;
00553                 LOGPRINTF("%s(%d) puts a tuple:", ctx->peername, ctx->id);
00554                 LOGTUPLE(s);
00555                 YIELDLOG;
00556 #endif
00557                 add_tuple_to_space(s);
00558                 // Why is this??? - Bram
00559                 /* send an ack */
00560                 send(ctx->sock, &operation, sizeof(int), MSG_NOSIGNAL);
00561                 // advise peer that we stop sending
00562                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00563         }
00564         else if (operation == GET) {
00565                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00566                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00567                 if (s == NULL) {
00568                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a template from client\n");
00569                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00570                 }
00571                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00572                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00573 //              GETLOG;
00574 //
00575 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00576 //              LOGPRINTF("GET socket=%d  ", ctx->sock);
00577 //              LOGTUPLE(s);
00578 //              YIELDLOG;
00579                 handle_get_read(ctx, s, 1, 1);
00580                 // advise peer that we stop sending
00581                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00582         }
00583         else if (operation == READ) {
00584                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00585                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00586                 if (s == NULL) {
00587                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a template from client\n");
00588                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00589                 }
00590                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00591                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00592 //              GETLOG;
00593 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00594 //              LOGPRINTF("READ socket=%d  ", ctx->sock);
00595 //              LOGTUPLE(s);
00596 //              YIELDLOG;
00597                 handle_get_read(ctx, s, 0, 1);
00598                 // advise peer that we stop sending
00599                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_WR);
00600         }
00601         else if (operation == GET_NB) {
00602                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00603                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00604                 if (s == NULL) {
00605                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a template from client\n");
00606                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00607                 }
00608                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00609                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00610 //              GETLOG;
00611 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00612 //              LOGPRINTF("GET_NB socket=%d  ", ctx->sock);
00613 //              LOGTUPLE(s);
00614 //              YIELDLOG;
00615                 handle_get_read(ctx, s, 1, 0);
00616         }
00617         else if (operation == READ_NB) {
00618                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00619                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00620                 if (s == NULL) {
00621                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a read template from client\n");
00622                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00623                 }
00624                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00625                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00626 //              GETLOG;
00627 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00628 //              LOGPRINTF("READ_NB socket=%d  ", ctx->sock);
00629 //              LOGTUPLE(s);
00630 //              YIELDLOG;
00631                 handle_get_read(ctx, s, 0, 0);
00632         }
00633         else if (operation == REPLACE) {
00634                 status_list[clientnr]='r';
00635                 t = recv_tuple(ctx);
00636                 if (t == NULL) {
00637                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a replace template from client\n");
00638                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00639                 }
00640                 s = recv_tuple(ctx);
00641                 if (s == NULL) {
00642                         fprintf(stderr,"Could not receive a replace tuple from client\n");
00643                         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00644                 }
00645                 // advise peer that we stop receiving
00646                 SHUTDOWN_SOCKET(ctx->sock, SHUT_RD);
00647                 handle_replace(ctx, t, s);
00648         }
00649         else if (operation == DUMP) {
00650 //              GETLOG;
00651 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00652 //              LOGPRINTF("DUMP socket=%d\n", ctx->sock);
00653 //              YIELDLOG;
00654                 handle_dump_count_space(ctx, 1);
00655         }
00656         else if (operation == COUNT) {
00657 //              GETLOG;
00658 //              LOGPRINTF("*******************\n");
00659 //              LOGPRINTF("COUNT socket=%d\n", ctx->sock);
00660 //              YIELDLOG;
00661                 handle_dump_count_space(ctx, 0);
00662         }
00663         else if (operation == LOG) {
00664                 GETLOG;
00665                 send(ctx->sock, logbuf, logptr, MSG_NOSIGNAL);
00666                 logptr = 0;
00667                 YIELDLOG;
00668                 /* kill thread, but don't LOGPRINTF */
00669                 close(ctx->sock);
00670                 ctx->thr = -1;
00671                 status_list[clientnr]='-';
00672                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00673         }
00674         else {
00675                 fprintf(stderr,
00676                         "Bad operation: %08X\n", (unsigned int) operation);
00677         }
00678         kill_this_thread(ctx);
00679         return NULL;
00680 }
00681 
00682 
00683 typedef void *(*threadfunction) (void *);
00684 
00689 int
00690 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00691 {
00692         int i, server_sock;
00693         int portnumber, status;
00694         int reuseaddr=1;
00695         struct sockaddr_in addr;
00696         pthread_attr_t threadattrs;
00697         size_t stacksz=0;
00698         int context_id=1;
00699         extern int pthread_setconcurrency(int new_level);
00700 
00701         i_am_server = 1;
00702 
00703         if (argc < 2) {
00704                 /* help message */
00705                 fprintf(stderr, "Need a port number as a cmd line arg\n");
00706                 exit(1);
00707         }
00708 
00709         portnumber = atoi(argv[1]);
00710         if (portnumber == 0) {
00711                 /* help message */
00712                 fprintf(stderr, "Need a port number as a cmd line arg\n");
00713                 exit(1);
00714         }
00715 
00716         pthread_setconcurrency(MAXNUMTHREADS);
00717         pthread_attr_init(&threadattrs);
00718         pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&threadattrs, 1);
00719         // We should not waste memory resource so use small stack sizes
00720         pthread_attr_getstacksize(&threadattrs, &stacksz);
00721 //      stacksz = PTHREAD_STACK_MIN;
00722         stacksz = 32768;
00723         if (pthread_attr_setstacksize(&threadattrs, stacksz))
00724                 perror("pthread_attr_setstacksize");
00725         pthread_attr_getstacksize(&threadattrs, &stacksz);
00726         assert(stacksz>0);
00727 //      fprintf(stderr,"stacksz is %d\n", stacksz);
00728 
00729         server_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00730         if (server_sock < 0) {
00731                 fprintf(stderr, __FILE__ " line %d\n", __LINE__);
00732                 perror("Can't create socket");
00733                 exit(1);
00734         }
00735 
00736         if (setsockopt(server_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &reuseaddr, sizeof(int)))
00737                 perror("setsockopt REUSEADDR");
00738 
00739         /* Open network listening socket */
00740         memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
00741         addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00742         addr.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00743         addr.sin_port = htons(portnumber);
00744 
00745         status = bind(server_sock,
00746                       (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00747         if (status < 0) {
00748                 fprintf(stderr, __FILE__ " line %d\n", __LINE__);
00749                 perror("bind() failed");
00750                 exit(1);
00751         }
00752 
00753         status = listen(server_sock, MAXNUMTHREADS);
00754         if (status < 0) {
00755                 fprintf(stderr, __FILE__ " line %d\n", __LINE__);
00756                 perror("listen() failed");
00757                 exit(1);
00758         }
00759 
00760         for (i = 0; i < MAXNUMTHREADS; i++) {
00761                 client_list[i].thr = -1;
00762                 status_list[i] = '-';
00763         }
00764         status_list[i]=0;
00765 
00766 #ifdef USE_SEMA
00767         sem_init(&tuple_space_access, 0, 1);
00768         sem_init(&log_sem, 0, 1);
00769         sem_init(&blocked_sem, 0, 0);
00770 #else
00771         if (pthread_mutex_init(&access_mutex,0)) perror("pthread_mutex_init");
00772         if (pthread_mutex_init(&log_mutex,0)) perror("pthread_mutex_init");
00773         if (pthread_mutex_init(&blocked_mutex,0)) perror("pthread_mutex_init");
00774         if (pthread_cond_init(&blocked_cond,0)) perror("pthread_cond_init");
00775 #endif
00776 
00777         pthread_t printthread_id;
00778         if (getenv("LINUXTUPLES_STATUS"))
00779                 pthread_create(&printthread_id, 0, (threadfunction) print_thread_func, 0);
00780 
00781         while (1) {
00782                 struct context ctx;
00783                 static int searchidx=0;
00784                 ctx.id = context_id++;
00785                 struct sockaddr_in otheraddr;
00786                 socklen_t otheraddrlen=sizeof(otheraddr);
00787                 memset(&otheraddr, 0, otheraddrlen);
00788                 ctx.sock = accept(server_sock, (struct sockaddr*) &otheraddr, &otheraddrlen);
00789                 while (1)
00790                         if (client_list[searchidx].thr == -1) {
00791                                 client_list[searchidx] = ctx;
00792                                 strcpy(client_list[searchidx].peername, inet_ntoa(otheraddr.sin_addr));
00793 
00794                                 if (pthread_create(&client_list[searchidx].thr,
00795                                                    &threadattrs,
00796                                                    client_thread_func,
00797                                                    &client_list[searchidx])
00798                                     != 0) {
00799                                         perror("pthread_create");
00800                                         fprintf(stderr, "Threads are hosed\n");
00801                                         EXIT();
00802                                 }
00803                                 searchidx = (searchidx+1) % MAXNUMTHREADS;
00804                                 break;
00805                         }
00806                         else
00807                                 searchidx = (searchidx+1) % MAXNUMTHREADS;
00808         }
00809 
00810         return 0;
00811 }
